intro: Chamaezelum alpinum, commonly known as the alpine chamaezelkum, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers and finely divided, fern-like leaves. It typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is often found in high-altitude meadows and is considered a rare and delicate species.
